    • Method Detail

      • evaluateTemplate

        public static String evaluateTemplate(String template)
                               throws IOException
        Evaluates an optionally templated string. If the template contains %hostname% the value is replaced by the current hostname of the system. If the template begins with external: the rest of the string is treated as a filename to load and use as the return value. For example, you may have a password you want to load at runtime from the filesystem, /tmp/foo1.example.com.txt, which contains the string bar and the current hostname is foo1.example.com. An input string with the external prefix and hostname template, such as external:/tmp/%hostname%.txt and this will be converted to bar. If the input is just a normal string, the original value is returned.
        Parameters:
        template - the templated string
        Returns:
        evaluated template
        Throws:
        IOException - on error when using filesystem

      • evaluateExternal

        public static String evaluateExternal(String template)
                               throws IOException
        Returns trimmed contents of a file when input string of form 'external:some/file/path' or just the original input otherwise.
        Parameters:
        template - string which may optionally begin with 'external:'.
        Returns:
        string with content of file when input templates, otherwise unchanged input.
        Throws:
        IOException - on errors reading from filesystem.

      • evaluateHostName

        public static String evaluateHostName(String template)
        Replaces a single occurrence of %hostname% template with the current hostname.
        Parameters:
        template - string which may optionally contain '%hostname%' template.
        Returns:
        string with '%hostname%' replaced with the current hostname, otherwise unchanged input.
